result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian W Creamer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay costs including DNA Surcharge
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian W Creamer in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:56 a.m. Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen covering on behalf of Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court (Atty Cousins needed to go to another courtroom)
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
*Pay $50 fine plus costs - DNA surcharge 
*Provide DNA sample unless already provided 
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Defendant Brian W Creamer in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Attorney Anne Renc in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Written waiver was filed.  Asks the case be set for Arraignment/Pre-trial. 

Court questions Atty Renc. 
Atty Renc responds.  Believes he is knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waiving the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waiving his right to prelim and it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian W Creamer
Current: 2821 Gaynor Ave, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495   (Effective: 12-10-2015)
Prior: 2021 Gaynor Ave, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495

Defendant Brian W Creamer in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
